Title: Object: Chorographica Terræ Sanctæ descriptio.
Description: Map of various aspects of the Holy Lands, in four compartments; in the lower half, a map of Palestine with the Mediterranean Sea its lower border, scale and compass; above: at left, a map of Ancient Syria, with scale and compass; at centre, a plan of the encampment of the Israelites in the desert; at right, a map of the wanderings of the Israelites in the desert, with scale and compass; illustration to 'Biblia Sacra Polyglotta', compiled by Brian Walton (London: 1657). Etching
Curator's comments: According to New Hollstein (Hollar) and Pennington, the plate was used as an illustration to the 'Biblia sacra polyglotta' (London, 1657) and the edition of the Bible printed by Field at Cambridge in 1660. See New Hollstein (Hollar) 1637-1643 for illustrations from this publication.
Bibliographic references: New Hollstein (German) / The New Hollstein: German engravings, etchings and woodcuts 1400-1700 (1638) (Hollar)
Pennington 1982 / A descriptive catalogue of the etched work of Wenceslaus Hollar (692)
Associated names: Illustration to: Brian Walter, Bishop of Chester (compiled by)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Hans Sloane (with Philipe's oval blindstamp and initials HS)
